docs.text:
1. Simple and clean documentation.

  3. Highly customizable.

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text:
Tip: MkDocs is great for creating documentation sites!

Warning

Be sure to keep your mkdocs.yml file updated.

docs.title: Welcome to the tutorial
docs.text: This page will show you how you can submit all type of content with Code and with example.

docs.title: My MkDocs Tutorial
docs.text: Welcome to the MkDocs tutorial for beginners! Here, you'll learn how to create content in MkDocs using simple Markdown syntax.

docs.title: 1. Heading and Subheading
docs.text: You can create headings using hash symbols (#).

docs.title: 1.1. Subheading
docs.text:
Subheadings are created by adding more hash symbols (## for subheadings, ### for smaller subheadings, and so on).

For example:

# Main Heading
## Subheading Level 1
### Subheading Level 2

docs.title: 2. Writing Text and Paragraphs
docs.text:
You can add simple text to your page. Simply type your content, and Markdown will automatically format it as paragraphs. For example:

This is a simple paragraph of text in MkDocs. MkDocs will automatically render paragraphs and organize them properly.
Just separate paragraph by leaving a blank line between them

docs.title: Example Paragraphs:
docs.text:
Here’s how you might write content with multiple paragraphs:

This is the first paragraph.

This is the second paragraph. It's also important to remember that MkDocs uses Markdown syntax to render text.

docs.title: 3. Emphasizing Text
docs.text:
You can emphasize text by using italic or bold syntax.

Italic Text is wrapped in one asterisk (). Bold Text is wrapped in two asterisks (*). Bold and Italic Text uses three asterisks.

This is *italic* text and this is **bold** text.

docs.title: 4. Links
docs.text:
To create a hyperlink, use the following syntax:

[Text to Display](https://www.example.com)

For Example : Visit Google for more information.

and this above code is 

Visit [Google](https://www.google.com) for more information.

docs.title: 5. Images
docs.text:
To add an image, use the syntax:

![Image Alt Text](path/to/image.jpg)

Example:

docs.title: 6. Adding Images from Your Computer
docs.text:
To add an image from your computer, place the image file in a folder within your MkDocs project (e.g., docs/images/) and reference it in your Markdown file.

Steps: Place Image in a Folder: Place your image file (e.g., my_image.jpg) in a folder like docs/images/.

Reference Image in Markdown: Use the following Markdown syntax to add the image:

![Image Alt Text](images/my_image.jpg)
This assumes the my_image.jpg file is located in the docs/images/ directory.

Example :

# Adding Images from Your Computer

Here is an image:

![Example Image](images/my_image.jpg)

If you want to add the image which is downloadable material and you want it to open in new tab then you can add it in the following manner 

<div style="position: relative; display: inline-block;">
  <!-- Image that opens in a new tab when clicked -->
  <a href="image.png" target="_blank">
    <img src="image.png" alt="Screenshot" style="max-width: 30%; height: auto;">
  </a>

  <!-- Download Icon in top-right corner -->
  <a href="image.png" download>
    <img src="https://img.icons8.com/material-outlined/24/000000/download--v1.png" 
         alt="Download Icon" 
         style="position: absolute; top: 10px; right: 10px; cursor: pointer; width: 24px;">
  </a>
</div>

The following is the example of that

docs.title: 7. Embedding a YouTube Video
docs.text:
You can add a YouTube video using an embedded link. To do this, use the Markdown syntax for linking, or you can embed the video using HTML directly.

Steps: Find the YouTube Video URL: Go to the YouTube video you want to embed, and copy its URL (e.g., https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ).

Add the YouTube Video Link in Markdown:

Option 1: Direct Link (Markdown)

[Watch this video on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ)

Option 2: Embed the Video (HTML)

Use an HTML iframe to embed the video directly into the page.

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dQw4w9WgXcQ" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Example: 

# Embedding a YouTube Video

You can watch this amazing video directly below:

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dQw4w9WgXcQ" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

docs.title: 8. Linking to Documents (PDF, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)
docs.text:
To link to external documents like PDF, Word, or PowerPoint files, follow these steps:

Steps: Place the Document in Your Project: Just like with images, you need to put the document (e.g., document.pdf, presentation.pptx, file.docx) into your docs folder or a subfolder (e.g., docs/files/).

Reference the Document in Markdown: Use the following Markdown syntax to create a link to the document.

Example for PDF, Word, or PowerPoint:

# Link to Documents

Here are some documents you can download:

- [Download PDF Document](files/document.pdf)
- [Download PowerPoint Presentation](files/presentation.pptx)
- [Download Word File](files/file.docx)

And if you want the pdf to be open in new tab then you can write like following 

<a href="split.pdf" target="_blank">Click here to view the PDF</a>

Following is the example of that

Click here to view the PDF

Example for Embedding a PDF (using HTML iframe): 

<iframe src="files/document.pdf" width="100%" height="600px"></iframe>

docs.title: 9. How to Add a PowerPoint (PPT) File
docs.text:
MkDocs doesn't render PowerPoint presentations directly, but you can still add a link to download a PowerPoint file, or if you want to display it in a viewable format, you can convert the PowerPoint to PDF or use an embedded service like Google Slides.

Steps: Upload the PowerPoint File to Your Project: Place the .pptx file in your docs folder or subfolder, e.g., docs/files/.

Add a Download Link in Markdown:

[Download PowerPoint Presentation](files/presentation.pptx)

docs.title: 10. Steps to Add a Video from a Computer (Uploaded Video)
docs.text:
# Uploading and Playing a Video

To upload and play a video from your computer in MkDocs, follow these steps:

1. Place the video in the `docs/videos/` folder.
2. Embed the video in your Markdown file using the HTML5 `<video>` tag.

## Example Video

Here is an example of a video uploaded to the project:

<video width="600" controls>
  <source src="videos/my_video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

And Following is the actual video uploaded from computer :

Your browser does not support the video tag.

docs.title: Linking to Documents
docs.text:
You can also provide links to download documents like PDFs, Word files, and PowerPoint presentations:

  • Download PDF Document
  • Download PowerPoint Presentation
  • Download Word File

docs.title: Summary of Markdown Syntax:
docs.text:
• # = Main Heading
  • ## = Subheading
  • Text = Paragraphs (separate with blank lines)
  • - or * = Unordered List
  • 1. = Ordered List
  • *italic* or **bold** = Emphasis
  • [Link](url) = Hyperlink
  • ![Alt Text](url) = Image

docs.title: Preview the Content
docs.text:
To see the changes you made in code, You can run following commands 

mkdocs build 
mkdocs serve

docs.title: If you get problem while creating content you can always visit
docs.text: MkDocs Material Image Reference

docs.title: To automatically copy and paste the code run the following command on your linus terminal
docs.text:
Verify that the updated_mkdocs.sh script exists in the appropriate directory.

Navigate to the Directory

Open your terminal and navigate to the directory where the updated_mkdocs.sh script is located. 

For example:

cd "/mnt/d/Web development projects"


Execute the script by running:

./updated_mkdocs.sh

docs.title: What Happens Next?
docs.text: The script will build the MkDocs site. It will automatically copy the updated files to the target directory. A success message will confirm that the process is complete.

docs.title: You can manually Set sizing and width and all the things manually like you set in html
docs.text:
For Example :

<p style="font-size: smaller; line-height: 1.5;">
The script will build the MkDocs site.<br>
It will automatically copy the updated files to the target directory.<br>
A success message will confirm that the process is complete.
</p>

in above code I set the manual size for the "P" tag

docs.title: PowerPoint Presentation
docs.text:
An example of a codeblock for python:

add_numbers.py
# Function to add two numbers 
def add_two_numbers(num1, num2):
    return num1 + num2 

# Example usage 
result = add_two_numbers(5, 3)
print('The sum is:', result)

Example codeblock for javascript with line highlighted:

concatenate_strings.js
// Function to concatenate two strings 
function concatenateStrings(str1, str2) {
    return str1 + str2;
}

// Example usage
const result = concatenateStrings("Hello, ", "World!");
console.log("The concatenated string is:", result);

docs.title: Sequence Diagram
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram 
  autonumber
  Server->>Terminal: Send request 
  loop Health 
    Terminal->>Terminal: Check for health 
  end 
  Note right of Terminal: System online 
  Terminal-->> Server: Everything is OK
  Terminal->>Database: Request customer data 
  Database-->>Terminal: Customer data
